ORDER as to Willie C. Moody as follows: (1) The Probation Department shall make immediate arrangements for a substance-abuse evaluation of defendant Willie C. Moody, and shall file the results of that evaluation with the court under seal. (2) The Probation Department shall make arrangements for defendant Moody to receive substance-abuse treatment at a residential-treatment facility. The Probation Department shall begin making such arrangements immediately, without waiting for the results of the evaluation, on the assumption that the results of the evaluation will warrant treatment. The Probation Department shall file a report of such arrangements with the court forthwith under seal. Signed by Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson on 3/27/2014. (ag, )

ORDER as to Willie C. Moody: Forfeiture Hearing set for 5/19/2014 10:00 AM in Courtroom 2FMJ before Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson. By April 11, 2014, the government shall file a supplemental brief indicating the specific evidence (offered at trial or to be offered at the forfeiture hearing) that justifies the forfeiture of each piece of property and explaining why, as well as relevant legal authority. By May 2, 2014, defendant Willie C. Moody is to file his response to the government's forfeiture brief (Doc. No. [405]) and the supplemental brief. The government may file a reply by May 9, 2014. Signed by Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson on 3/28/2014. (ag, )

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson:Hearing re In-Patient Treatment as to Willie C. Moody held on 4/1/2014 (PDF available for court use only) (Court Reporter Mitchell Reisner.) (ag, )

ORDER as to Willie C. Moody that: (1) Upon the availability of a bed at the Chemical Addictions Program, defendant Willie C. Moody is to be released from custody, under such conditions as shall be determined by the magistrate judge, to complete that Program. (2) If, after successfully completing the Chemical Addictions Program, defendant Moody is eligible for and a bed is available at the Herring Houses, his release should be continued, under such conditions as shall be determined by the magistrate judge, to complete that program as well. Signed by Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson on 4/2/2014. (ag, )
Minute Entry for Bond Hearing held before Honorable Judge Terry F. Moorer as to Willie C. Moody on 4/2/2014 (PDF available for court use only) (Recording Time 10:06-10:10.) (cb, )

ORDER as to Willie C. Moody: Sentencing set for 6/25/2014 10:00 AM in Courtroom 2FMJ before Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson. Any motion for downward departure shall be filed on or before the conference date with the probation officer, unless based on unknown and unforeseen circumstances arising after that date, in which case the motion must be filed promptly upon discovery of such circumstances. Five business days before the sentencing date, the Government and the defendant shall each file a memorandum setting forth (a) the sentence the defendant should receive and (b) why that sentence is appropriate based on the facts and the law. Signed by Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson on 4/8/2014. (ag, ) (Main Document 464 replaced on 7/9/2014)to correct order (ag, ).

ORDER as to Willie C. Moody: Resetting Forfeiture Hearing now set for 5/19/14 to 5/9/2014 10:00 AM in Courtroom 2FMJ before Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson. By April 11, 2014, the government shall file a supplemental brief indicating the specific evidence (offered at trial or to offered at the forfeiture hearing) that justifies the forfeiture of each piece of property and explaining why, as well as setting forth the relevant authority. By April 28, 2014, defendant Willie C. Moody is to file his response to the government's forfeiture brief (Doc. No. [405]) and the supplemental brief. The government may file a reply by May 2, 2014. Signed by Honorable Judge Myron H. Thompson on 4/9/2014. (ag, )
